description: Impose Mid-Pliocene Warm Period (3.2 Ma ago) boundary conditions for ice sheet and land-sea mask, topography (smaller ice sheets),  the atmospheric concentration of well-mixed greenhouse gases and orbital parameters.  Run for at least 100 years after spin-up. It is mandatory that the model versions used for the PMIP-CMIP6 experiments are the exactly the same as for the other CMIP6 experiments, in particular the DECK and historical simulations.
keywords: PMIP, Tier 1, PlioExp, Pliiocene warm, 3.2 Ma
rationale: How does the Earth System respond in the long term to CO2 forcing analogous to that of the modern?  What is the significance of CO2 induced polar amplification for the stability of the ice sheets, sea-ice and sea-level?
